result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torii T Norris

10:05 AM Defendant Torii T Norris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD in 22CF1267 and 22CF2614 but has not yet been appointed counsel, requested adjournment. No objection by State.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

SPD appointment of counsel report

$2,000 bond previously posted to apply

- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 11

1:51 PM Defendant Torii T Norris in court.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Torii T Norris.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:59 AM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies for SPD but atty hasn't been appt'd yet. Court explained the process/options to the defn. Court found good cause to waive time limits. New date set.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defn is eligible for SPD (confirme) but no appointment has been made as of yet; hearing to be reset
Defn appeared after issuance of Bench Warrant; quashed by Court and PH scheduled.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:37 PM  Defendant appeared at 12:30 p.m.following issuance of Bench Warrant earlier today.  Defn thought time of hearing was 12:30 p.m.  Defn has been approved for public defender; awaiting appt.  Court quashs Bench Warrant and finds good cause to set matter over for further proceedings.  Prelim Hearing scheduled for 6/30/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
QUASHED

10:07 AM Defendant does not appear.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests Bench Warrant.  Defn was released on 6/6/2022 on $2000 cash bail.  Defn not present today; requesting bail be forfeited.  Court grants request for body-only Bench Warrant; bail is revoked.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Timothy K, Leland R, or Karon G. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

04:52 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
